meanings.definition: The act or process of making something human-like.
meanings.sent1: The hominizations of the robot gave it a friendly face.
meanings.sent2: The hominizations of the cartoon character made it relatable to kids.
meanings.sent3: The hominizations of the alien in the movie made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her hominizations of the animal kingdom in her drawings were truly imaginative.
meanings.sent5: The hominizations of the toy dinosaur made it seem almost alive.

meanings.definition: The process of adapting to human behavior or characteristics.
meanings.sent1: The hominizations of the AI technology allowed it to interact seamlessly with humans.
meanings.sent2: The hominizations of the company's policies reflected a customer-centric approach.
meanings.sent3: The hominizations of the cat trying to open the door were quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The hominizations of the plant reaching towards the sunlight were truly remarkable.
meanings.sent5: Her hominizations of the car's personality made it stand out from the rest.
